content.question: Which of the following is an antiderivative of <math alttext="lowercase f of x, equals, the tangent of, open parenthesis, e to the x power, plus, the fraction pi over 2, close parenthesis " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>tan</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> on <math alttext="0 is less than or equal to x, is less than or equal to, the natural log of, open parenthesis, pi over 2, close parenthesis " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the secant squared of, open parenthesis, e to the x power, plus, the fraction pi over 2, close parenthesis " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>sec</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator the natural log of, the absolute value of, the secant of, open parenthesis, e to the x power, plus, the fraction pi over 2, close parenthesis, end absolute value, and denominator e to the x power, end fraction " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>|</mo><mi>sec</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>|</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the integral from, 0 to e to the x power, of, the tangent of, open parenthesis, t plus, the fraction pi over 2, close parenthesis, d t " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>tan</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the integral from, 0 to x, of, the tangent of, open parenthesis, e to the t power, plus, the fraction pi over 2, close parenthesis, d t " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>tan</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the integral from, 0 to x, of, the tangent of, open parenthesis, e to the t power, plus, the fraction pi over 2, close parenthesis, d t " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>tan</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

topic.text: 6.7: The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus and Definite Integrals
